findings.headline_es: 6 de cada 10 estudiantes en riesgo no son detectados por Alerta Escuela
findings.headline_en: 6 in 10 at-risk students are missed by Peru's Alerta Escuela early warning system
findings.explanation_es: El sistema de alerta temprana falla en detectar al 63.3% de los estudiantes hispanohablantes que efectivamente abandonan la escuela. Esta tasa de falsos negativos significa que la mayoria de los estudiantes en riesgo nunca reciben intervencion.
findings.explanation_en: The early warning system fails to flag 63.3% of Spanish-speaking students who actually drop out. This false negative rate means the majority of at-risk students never receive intervention.

findings.headline_es: Sesgo de vigilancia: estudiantes indigenas son sobremarcados (52.1% FPR) mientras hispanohablantes son invisibilizados (63.3% FNR)
findings.headline_en: Surveillance bias: indigenous students are over-flagged (52.1% FPR) while Spanish-speakers are invisible (63.3% FNR)
findings.explanation_es: El modelo detecta mejor a estudiantes de lenguas indigenas (FNR=21.6%) pero los sobremarca como en riesgo cuando no lo estan (FPR=52.1%). Para hispanohablantes ocurre lo inverso: pasan desapercibidos con un FNR del 63.3%.
findings.explanation_en: The model catches more indigenous-language students (FNR=21.6%) but over-flags them when they are not at risk (FPR=52.1%). For Spanish-speakers, the pattern reverses: they go undetected at a 63.3% false negative rate.

metric_source.label: FPR for Other Indigenous language group

findings.headline_es: 3 de cada 4 estudiantes indigenas urbanos en riesgo no son detectados por el sistema
findings.headline_en: 3 in 4 urban indigenous students at risk are completely missed by the early warning system
findings.explanation_es: Los estudiantes indigenas en zonas urbanas son los mas invisibles para el sistema, con un FNR del 75.3%. Aunque son una muestra pequena (n=89), el patron sugiere que el sistema asocia riesgo con ruralidad, no con vulnerabilidad linguistica urbana.
findings.explanation_en: Urban indigenous students are the most invisible to the system, with a 75.3% false negative rate. While the sample is small (n=89), the pattern suggests the model associates risk with rurality, missing linguistic vulnerability in cities.

findings.stat: Top-5 SHAP features: age, nightlight_intensity_z, is_working, census_indigenous_lang_pct_z, census_literacy_rate_z; 0/5 overlap with logistic regression identity features
findings.headline_es: El modelo predice desercion a traves de la pobreza y la geografia, no de la identidad del estudiante
findings.headline_en: The model predicts dropout through poverty and geography, not student identity
findings.explanation_es: Los 5 factores mas influyentes segun SHAP son estructurales: edad, luminosidad nocturna (proxy de urbanizacion), situacion laboral, porcentaje de lengua indigena del distrito y alfabetizacion censal. Ninguno coincide con las variables identitarias que dominan el modelo lineal.
findings.explanation_en: The 5 most influential factors according to SHAP are structural: age, nightlight intensity (urbanization proxy), employment status, district indigenous language prevalence, and census literacy rate. None overlap with the identity features that dominate the linear model.

findings.headline_es: Alerta Escuela no detecta a 6 de cada 10 estudiantes en riesgo en la region Selva
findings.headline_en: Alerta Escuela misses 6 in 10 at-risk students in the Selva region (Amazon basin)
findings.explanation_es: En la Selva, el sistema falla en detectar al 59.3% de los estudiantes que abandonan la escuela. La region amazonica presenta las condiciones mas dificiles para la prediccion: alta dispersion geografica, menor conectividad y poblaciones indigenas diversas.
findings.explanation_en: In the Selva (Amazon basin), the system fails to flag 59.3% of students who drop out. The Amazon region presents the hardest prediction conditions: high geographic dispersion, lower connectivity, and diverse indigenous populations.

findings.stat: Pearson r = -0.071 between predictions and admin rates
findings.headline_es: Las predicciones distritales no coinciden con las tasas oficiales de desercion (r = -0.071)
findings.headline_en: District-level predictions show near-zero correlation with official dropout rates (r = -0.071)
findings.explanation_es: La correlacion de Pearson entre las predicciones agregadas del modelo y las tasas de desercion del MINEDU es practicamente nula (r = -0.071). Esto sugiere que el modelo de alerta individual no se traduce en patrones distritales coherentes con las estadisticas administrativas.
findings.explanation_en: The Pearson correlation between aggregated model predictions and Peru's Ministry of Education (MINEDU) dropout rates is near zero (r = -0.071). This suggests the individual alert model does not translate into district-level patterns consistent with administrative statistics.

metric_source.label: Pearson r between model predictions and admin dropout rates

findings.headline_es: La brecha de equidad por sexo es minima: solo 3.3% de diferencia en FNR
findings.headline_en: The gender equity gap is minimal: only 3.3% FNR difference between boys and girls
findings.explanation_es: A diferencia de la lengua y la geografia, el modelo trata de manera casi equitativa a ninos y ninas, con una brecha de FNR de solo 3.3%. Este hallazgo positivo contrasta con las disparidades criticas encontradas en otras dimensiones.
findings.explanation_en: Unlike language and geography, the model treats boys and girls nearly equally, with an FNR gap of just 3.3%. This positive finding contrasts sharply with the critical disparities found across linguistic and regional dimensions.

metric_source.label: Maximum FNR gap between sex groups
